section.title: Motivation
section.para: The idea in this short document is to figure out how to use a dynamic, reproducible document to create a single document which has content computed on different machines. We could use a cluster-computing approach where we dispatch commands to different machines and get the result of interest. That is probably the "best" way to achieve the goal, but requires a lot of installed software. So instead, let's see if we can use a more basic approach using XML/XSL and IDynDocs.

The idea is this. We create an XML document which contains the computations of interest. We'll be very explicit for the moment and later relax the strictness. We are going to fill in a table with timings for a particular computation within the document.
